notesStmt.note: Front and back flyleaves come from a printed edition of Seder ha-hafṭarot.Folio 143v contains notes of the former owners, including an entry of birth dated 1684, and some astrological calculations.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msItem.title: Perush Tiḳune Zohar פרוש תקוני הזהר

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Italian cursive script of the 17th century. Apparently an autograph of Samuel ben Elisha Portaleone.

binding.p: Modern binding, hard-board cover with ivory leather spine. Spine: 'Perush Tikkune Haz-Zohar, Etc. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Additional 27,090.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Giuseppe Almanzi (b. 1801, d. 1860), bibliophile; his manuscript no. 196: his library including 322 medieval Hebrew manuscripts were purchased en bloc by the British Museum in October 1865 for £1,000 through Asher & Co., Berlin dealer to the British Museum (see 131-153): inscribed, folio [160v] (fse001v).
